result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark Ii Mergener was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Filed by Atty John C Orth

Defendant Mark Ii Mergener in court with attorney John Chappell Orth.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count one. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence: $768.00 fine, 60 days to pay fine or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts. Submit DNA sample. One day jail credit.

Return date scheduled for October 16, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
